title: Firefox download corrupt?
content: While working on my school bus route for next week, I couldn't find some addresses using google maps. Called the school to confirm the address. They had no problem, must be me. Ran system mechanic full system scan, and found three trojans in fire fox. Everything worked okay after they were deleted. Decided to refresh fire fox to make sure no damage was done to my copy on disk. Ran system mechanic again after refresh. They were back! Deleted them again and holding my breath.

title: Fonts are sometimes rendered too thin
content:
For the past 5 or 6 major versions of Firefox, in some websites, sometimes the fonts used are rendered too thin, making it difficult to read. It's inconsistent though, it affects some websites but others not, a website may be affected today but not tomorrow, hitting ctrl+f5 several times or closing and reopening the browser a couple times, sometimes fix it, sometimes not.

Looking at the font inspector, I couldn't find a specific font family that causes it, seems to be random too. Font settings are at the default. The source of the font file seems not to matter as well, it can be Google fonts, local fonts, the website server itself, even when developing locally... it's the same.

Now in Firefox 103 none of the "tricks" I mentioned before are capable of fixing the problem when it happens to a particular website. I've seen a lot of questions in this forum about the same problem but nothing helps.

In the attached screenshots you can see the difference between how it looks with and without the issue.
creator: faelv

creator: clarastrano

title: Firefox won't open attachment/finder windows
content:
For approximately 8 months now, I have issues where - on occasion - Firefox will not open the attachment or finder window on my browser when prompted to by clicking the appropriate button on a website.

For instance, if I am in my gmail, and want to attach a file to an email, I will click the paperclip button. Normally, a tiny finder/browser window would open where I select the file and attach it. That will not occur. No window comes up for me to do that until I close Firefox completely and restart it.

Similarly, if I were on Facebook and wanted to upload a picture to my feed, I would click 'post' followed by 'add photo/video.' Normally at this time a window would pop up for me to select something from my computer, but nay, Firefox will not do so unless I completely shut down the program and restart it.

Once I restart it, either by closing all of my tabs and closing the program completely (using latest Mac OS), or 'force quitting' Firefox, the programs work find and selection windows appear.

That said, it's incredibly frustrating when you're working on something or have a bunch of tabs open for whatever reason.

I have made sure that my OS and Firefox are both up to date. It doesn't stop the problem. The only help files I've found suggest this is a recurring problem that bug fixes have been put out in the past, but can't find a permanent solution.

Please help!
creator: bkulbacki

title: Unable to access ANY internet page with ONLY firefox
content:
Hello, help in FRench would be welcome 'cause the faulty Firefox is set in FRench. So, as said : Unable to access ANY internet page with ONLY firefox under Win 10 It says "Attention : risque probable de sécurité" (probable security risk) Since the problem occured : - Firefox has been reinstalled and is up to date (104.0.1 64bits) - Proxy parameter has been set to NO proxy - Sync/Account has been disconnected (and unable to reconnect due to this pb) + Others Windows accounts do NOT have this problem On some servers, I can ACCEPT the RISK and access www but NOT on https://accounts.firefox.com

Code d’erreur : SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER [Certificat] Nom de l’émetteur Nom courant AdBlocker Ultimate 2 (But this extension is NOT loaded)

Any help is welcome, thanks in advance !

title: Do Cookies Move Along with the 'Open in New Container Tab'
content:
Good day,

Started playing with the 'Container Tabs' add-on in Firefox. I noticed that there are instances that when a website opens up in Firefox, it may open up in a 'general' tab that has not been assigned a container. Let's say that this website installs cookies, will they be carried on into the new container when right clicking the tab to choose 'Open in New Container Tab'?

My concern is that one would otherwise create a pool of cookies that are not carried along into the new container(s), and that are potentially accessible by cross-site tracking cookies that made or make their way into that same pool.

Looking forward to insights!
creator: AmsterDan
